Rand Paul: Obama is working with ‘anti-American globalists plot[ting] against our Constitution.’ By Ezra Klein, Published: May 11, 2013 at 12:42 pmE-mail reporter The New York Times calls Sen. Rand Paul (Ky.) one of the Republican Party’s “rising stars.” The Daily Beast says he’s “a smoother, more pragmatic political operator” than his father, former congressman and presidential candidate Ron Paul (R-Tex.). All that seems true. So riddle me this: What’s the upside for Paul to put his name on e-mails like this one, which landed in my inbox this morning? It’s one thing for no-name pols to work on the fringes. But Paul, at this point, has a lot to lose. Yet here he is, suggesting the current president of the United States is working with “anti-American globalists plot[ting] against our Constitution.” And for what?

Message.Title: scandal!!!! irs IRS targets group over political remarks
Message.Msg: impeach Obama!! Joe Biden for president...... ha ha ha ha IRS targets group over political remarks October 29, 2004| WASHINGTON — The Internal Revenue Service has begun reviewing the tax-exempt status of the NAACP, citing concerns over a speech by Chairman Julian Bond at the group's annual convention last July. In an Oct. 8 letter released Thursday, the IRS told the NAACP it had received information that Bond conveyed "statements in opposition of George W. Bush for the office of presidency" and specifically "condemned the administration policies of George W. Bush in education, the economy and the war in Iraq."

Message.Title: A Brit comments on their National Health Service
Message.Msg: found this on another board: " I was born and raised in the UK, and am forever grateful to the UK National Health Service for the care and attention I received throughout the years (and yes, if I chose private care for any reason or condition, I could pay privately and still continue to use the NHS as I saw appropriate). The one startling thing about coming to America and becoming a US citizen has been trying to get my head around the utter stupidity - real, festering stupidity - of conservatives who are terrified of Universal Health Care, while having no experience of it. Care is NOT denied under the British system (American insurance companies, however, are happy to deny care when their profit margins are threatened)... and outcomes in the UK are better than in the US. And we spend less on health care! But all that underinformed Americans know of the NHS is the preposterous propaganda produced by the insurance companies, who don't give one whit about your health, just about making money out of you in your greatest need."
